Optical flow utilities

Contrast + directions

circle_bundles.get_contrast_norms(data, *, patch_type='opt_flow')[source]

Vectorized contrast norms.

Parameters:

  • data (array of shape (N, n^2) for intensity patches,) – or (N, 2*n^2) for optical flow (u then v).

  • patch_type ({'img','opt_flow','flow'}) – ‘flow’ is accepted as an alias for ‘opt_flow’.

Returns:

norms

Return type:

(N,) array, sqrt( x^T D x ) (and sum across u,v for flow)

circle_bundles.get_dct_basis(N, *, normalize=True, opt_flow=False, top_two=False)[source]

Generate a 2D DCT-II basis for N×N patches.

Return type:

ndarray

Returns:

  • basis ((M, N^2) if opt_flow=False) – (2*M, 2*N^2) if opt_flow=True (stack horizontal then vertical)

  • where M = N^2 (or N^2-1 if normalize=True, since DC is dropped).

Parameters:

  • N (int)

  • normalize (bool)

  • opt_flow (bool)

  • top_two (bool)

Notes

  • If normalize=True, drop the DC component, mean-center each basis vector, then contrast-normalize using get_contrast_norms (via flow padding trick).

circle_bundles.get_predominant_dirs(patches)[source]

Predominant direction in RP^1 via PCA of (u_i, v_i) vectors across pixels.

Parameters:

patches ((N, 2*n^2))

Return type:

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Returns:

  • predom_dirs ((N,) angles in [0, pi))

  • ratios ((N,) directionality score in [0,1] ( (λ1-λ2)/λ1 ))

circle_bundles.get_lifted_predominant_dirs(flow_patches, *, eps=1e-12)[source]

For each patch, find the pixel with largest flow magnitude and return its unit vector.

Parameters:

  • flow_patches ((N, 2*n^2))

  • eps (float)

Returns:

unit

Return type:

(N,2) unit vectors (zeros where magnitude is tiny)

Frames and annotation

circle_bundles.change_path(flow_path, old_base, new_base)[source]

Map a Sintel .flo path to its corresponding .png frame path.

Return type:

Path

Parameters:

  • flow_path (str | Path)

  • old_base (str | Path)

  • new_base (str | Path)

Example

old_base/…/flow/<scene>/frame_0001.flo

-> new_base/…/clean/<scene>/frame_0001.png

circle_bundles.get_labeled_frame(frame_path, save_path, patch_df, *, dot_radius=3, custom_colors=('#4B0082', '#FF4500', '#ADD8E6'), show=False)[source]

Draw colored dots at patch locations on a Sintel frame.

patch_df must have columns: [‘row’, ‘column’, ‘color’]. ‘color’ can be any hashable ID (ints/strings). IDs are mapped to custom_colors.

Parameters:

  • frame_path (str | Path)

  • save_path (str | Path | None)

  • patch_df (DataFrame)

  • dot_radius (int)

  • custom_colors (Sequence[str])

  • show (bool)

circle_bundles.write_video_from_frames(image_files, output_video, *, fps=10.0, codec='MJPG')[source]

Write an AVI video from a sequence of image paths using OpenCV.

Return type:

None

Parameters:

  • image_files (Sequence[str | Path])

  • output_video (str | Path)

  • fps (float)

  • codec (str)

circle_bundles.get_labeled_video(flo_paths, *, scene_num, patch_df, inds_list, old_flow_base, new_frame_base, out_dir, fps=10.0)[source]

Create a labeled-frame video for a single scene.

patch_df must contain at least columns: [‘scene’,’frame’,’row’,’column’]. inds_list is a list of boolean masks (length == len(patch_df)) selecting patches. Each mask becomes one color group (0,1,2,…).

Return type:

Path

Parameters:

  • flo_paths (Sequence[str | Path])

  • scene_num (int)

  • patch_df (DataFrame)

  • inds_list (Sequence[ndarray])

  • old_flow_base (str | Path)

  • new_frame_base (str | Path)

  • out_dir (str | Path)

  • fps (float)

Notes

Assumes flo_paths are ordered by frame number, corresponding to frames 1..T.

circle_bundles.annotate_optical_flow(image_dir, flow_dir, save_dir, *, lattice_res=(20, 30), scale=0.2, width=0.0025, arrow_color='red')[source]

Overlay optical flow vectors at lattice points on each frame and save as PDFs. Skips the last image in image_dir (since it may not have a .flo match).

Return type:

None

Parameters:

  • image_dir (str | Path)

  • flow_dir (str | Path)

  • save_dir (str | Path)

  • lattice_res (Tuple[int, int])

  • scale (float)

  • width (float)

  • arrow_color (str)

circle_bundles.get_sintel_scene_folders(base_path, scene_type='clean', scene='all')[source]

Return folder paths for each scene in Sintel.

base_path should contain subfolders like: ‘clean’, ‘final’, ‘flow’

Return type:

list[Path]

Parameters:

  • base_path (str | Path)

  • scene_type (str)

  • scene (str)

Flow processing

circle_bundles.read_flo(file)[source]

Read a Middlebury/Sintel .flo optical flow file.

Returns:

flow

Return type:

(H, W, 2) float32 array

Parameters:

file (str | Path)

circle_bundles.sample_from_frame(flo_path, n_patches, *, d=3, rng=None)[source]

Sample n_patches random dxd optical flow patches from a .flo file.

Returns:

samples – [0 : d*d) : u components (flattened Fortran order) [d*d : 2*d*d) : v components [-2], [-1] : (row, col) top-left corner in the frame

Return type:

(n_patches, 2*d*d + 2) array

Parameters:

  • flo_path (str | Path)

  • n_patches (int)

  • d (int)

  • rng (Generator | None)

circle_bundles.get_patch_sample(flow_root, *, patches_per_frame=385, d=3, random_state=0)[source]

Sample patches_per_frame from every .flo file under flow_root//.flo.

Return type:

Tuple[DataFrame, List[List[Path]]]

Returns:

  • patch_df (DataFrame with columns [‘patch’,’row’,’column’,’scene’,’frame’]) – where ‘patch’ stores a 1D np.ndarray of length 2*d*d.

  • file_paths (list of lists of .flo Paths, grouped by scene folder order)

Parameters:

  • flow_root (str | Path)

  • patches_per_frame (int)

  • d (int)

  • random_state (int)

circle_bundles.preprocess_flow_patches(patch_df, *, hc_frac=0.2, max_samples=50000, k_list=(300,), random_state=42)[source]

Preprocess optical flow patches in patch_df.

Requires patch_df[‘patch’] to contain length-2*n^2 vectors.

Steps: - infer n - compute x/y mean - compute contrast norm + keep top hc_frac - downsample to max_samples - mean-center + contrast-normalize - compute density estimates 1 / dist_to_kNN for each k in k_list - sort by largest k density (descending)

Return type:

DataFrame

Parameters:

  • patch_df (DataFrame)

  • hc_frac (float)

  • max_samples (int)

  • k_list (Sequence[int])

  • random_state (int)

Patch visualization

circle_bundles.make_patch_visualizer(*, fig_size=3.0, dpi=120, intensity_cmap='gray', intensity_normalize='minmax', show_intensity_grid=True, intensity_grid_lw=0.8, flipud=True, flow_normalize='maxmag', quiver_width=0.02, headwidth=5, headlength=5, grid_lw=7, border_lw_mult=2.0)[source]

Canonical patch visualizer.

  • intensity (n^2): uses imshow, optional grid overlay

  • flow (2*n^2): quiver arrows on grid, optional vertical flip for display convention

Return type:

vis_func(patch_vector) -> matplotlib Figure

Parameters:

  • fig_size (float)

  • dpi (int)

  • intensity_cmap (str)

  • intensity_normalize (Literal['minmax', 'none'])

  • show_intensity_grid (bool)

  • intensity_grid_lw (float)

  • flipud (bool)

  • flow_normalize (Literal['maxmag', 'none'])

  • quiver_width (float)

  • headwidth (float)

  • headlength (float)

  • grid_lw (float)

  • border_lw_mult (float)
